title: Lorraine Kelly jokes Ant and Dec will win NTA they're not even nominated for
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The nominees for the hotly-anticipated National Television Awards have been announced today – so you can vote for your favourite soaps, presenters and TV shows.

Comedy duo Ant and Dec have been nominated for the best TV Presenter category yet again, meaning they could be taking the gong home for 19th year running.

Lorraine Kelly has also been nominated for two awards including best TV Presenter and best Live Magazine Show, and on her show this morning she couldn’t help but joke about Ant and Dec (and all their awards).

Advertisement

Advertisement

At the introduction of show, the ITV host announced she was nominated for a National Television Award – but as she told viewers she couldn’t help but make a dig at Ant and Dec.

As she laughed she said: ‘Although you know that Ant and Dec win everything.

Ant and Dec won The Bruce Forsyth Entertainment Award and TV Presenter Awards at the NTAs in 2018 (Picture: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

We found it funny too Lorraine…(Picture: ITV)

‘They will probably even win this category even though they’re not in it.’

Other nominees for the NTA’s include EastEnders and Coronation Street who will both be vying to break Emmerdale’s three-year winning streak.

There are 14 different categories for 2020, including a brand new ‘Challenge’ category in which hit shows such as The Circle and Race Across The World are longlisted alongside the likes of favourites such as Love Island and The Great British Bake Off.

Lorraine airs weekdays at 8.30am on ITV.
